headline.print_headline: Do Not Track? Advertisers Say ‘Don’t Tread on Us’
headline.seo: Do-Not-Track Movement Is Drawing Advertisers’ Fire
headline.main: Do Not Track? Advertisers Say ‘Don’t Tread on Us’

docs.abstract: Natasha Singer Slipstream column observes that advertisers are girding for battle against 'Do Not Track' movement, which features browser mechanisms intended to offer more online privacy; points out nothing less than the future of the surveillance economy is at stake, and notes two sides seem to have reached impasse.
docs.lead_paragraph: Advertisers are girding for battle against browser mechanisms intended to offer more online privacy. At stake is nothing less than the future of the surveillance economy.
docs.snippet: Advertisers are girding for battle against browser mechanisms intended to offer more online privacy. At stake is nothing less than the future of the surveillance economy.
